column5: They are family.
Always a sad day Darren..hope you and your family are remembering all the good times!

I want to thank everyone that thought about me and Winston! Winston was a therapy dog with St Johns and was considered one of the best one's they ever had. He was with me thru some bad times. i knew the time was coming and he did too. He waited till I came from work ,into the room at the vet, looked at me and passed away.  We got a new little buddie this spring and they were in seperable, the old guy and the puppie. His name is Loki  You may have seen his dad Munch on the Iam's commercials. He is a pretty awesome awesome puppy thanks to Winston.        I got a bunch of pictures with the 3 amigo's just a few days ago cuz I felt the time was near.         Scottyswing....your right!  Thanks again to everyone, guess I have become one of those crazy dog people.    Darren

My sincere condolences Darren....my wife and I have lost a few of our boys over the past years and we just had to put our cat down last week while we were off on vacation..we definately know how you're feeling..

Aren't Bulldogs the best!?  Lola is 8 months old, and my first Bully. I don't think I'll live a day in my life without one now. Another is soon on his way as i think they are even more fun when they have a friend or two.  So glad to hear Winston went with you near. Always comforting to know you were there till the end. And he was surely grateful for your love.  Lots of happy dog days ahead for you friend
My best friend left me yesterday, he was always there no matter if the times were good or bad.  Ill miss you Winston
Tough times I'm sure Darren ! He looks like he was kept well fed ..
Takes a part of our heart with them when they go.My condolences, i know exactly how you feel.
Always hard  I couldn't imagine losing my little bulldog.
My condolences...he looked like a great friend...part of your family.

My dog hasn't left my side since I got home from work an hour ago.. Well, that's cuz I stopped by the beer store on the way home, and she's an alcoholic..  Sorry to here about your loss bucktail.  From that picture, it looks like he had some real character.
I'm always sorry to hear of the loss of a good friend, my condolences.
Winston was the name of my 2nd English Bull growing up.  The first was Clancy and the third(my dog) was Fred.  Amazing animals!    Heartfelt condolences
Sorry to hear the news Darren, a dog is one of the best friends we can ever have, and losing him is always tough to go through.  Condolances from one dog lover to another.
dang very sorry to here this
I'm not really a dog person, but if I had one I'd want it to look just like Winston. He is one fine specimen
Sorry to hear...it's always a tough day.
Sorry to hear that Darren. It's always tough to let go.
Soooo hard! I feel for ya. Always look back and smile, as you showed that guy a wonderful and spoiled life IM SURE!
My condolences,
Sorry for your loss......he looks like a fine pal. I lost my flatcoat Seamus in June. I wept like a child. Amazing how much dogs can become such an important part of your lives.
I'm very sorry for your loss.
Sorry for your loss, I dred the day.....
Sorry for your loss, it's tough losing your best buddy.
Sorry to hear that Winston is gone Darren. My condolences to you and your family.
Puppies make everything better!!!!
Puppies make everything better!!!!
So very sorry for your loss. I can't begin to image your grief.
sorry for your loss
That's rough.....remember the good times
